newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SEXWALE NOT IN S.AFRICAN LEADERSHIP RACE, ANC SAYS.
newsitem.headline: SEXWALE NOT IN S.AFRICAN LEADERSHIP RACE, ANC SAYS.

text.p: Tokyo Sexwale, leader of the African National Congress in Gauteng province, is not in the running to succeed South African President Nelson Mandela, the Gauteng branch of the ANC said on Monday.

"The ANC in Gauteng wants to put on record that Comrade Tokyo Sexwale will not be available for the position of presidency of the country nor will he be available for the deputy president's position in 1999," a statement said.

"The ANC in Gauteng fully supports this move by Sexwale, and is sure that this will put a stop to all speculation that he will contest the position of presidency against Comrade Thabo Mbeki," the statement said.
